caption: Amazing quality food with a wide variety of choice selection. The quinoa corn side and the chili sweet potatoes were amazing. Good quality meats in the bowl meals. A little pricier for the fast-meal service, but definitely worth it.

I liked it a lot, but I didn't like what I ordered. I think I had the power bowl? Idk but it was vegan! It had parsley (not a fan) mint (not a fan) and tofu! It would have been perfect without the parsley or mint! I will try something else next time tho!
The food was so nice and fresh... Friendly staff good place overall. Thanks to Slim for the hospitality and taking the time out to speak with us  ...
Great atmosphere and great food. The avocado toast, Brussels sprouts, and mac and cheese are my go to's !!
The food is amazing.
Great veggies and variety of options for vegetarians and vegans, with gluten free items as well.
Lovely place
In my opinion this place is overpriced and the portions are quite small. My bowl was too way salty and I did not finish it. Evenings is very noisy.

You guys have to fix the carryout section. Nobody pays attention on how long the customer is waiting. It's my decsec time ordering and both times I wanted 30 + minutes on a mondMo at 8:00 pm. Never coming back.

The food was delicious. Loved the place for healthy and the same time tasty options. The server was super nice. The only problem  was the smoke and the smell, which may be the only reason for me not to go back. When I asked about the smoke I was told that it is a residential building so they don't have a ventilation system or something like that. I can understand that it is DC and a lot of old buildings, but it is not pleasant to dine in smoke and have the smell all over you hair and clothing. If they have online delivery I may use that option

I’m in love! Sadly I’m leaving soon since I’m in Maryland on a business trip. Almost two weeks in is when I Googled and came across this gem. Ordered the tomato toast, glow bowl - add steak, vegan-gluten free chocolate pudding and, on tap, kombucha (Apple cider). Very delicious! Very satisfying! Couldn’t finish it so that gives an idea of portion size (took my order ‘to go’). I live near Chicago so hoping one will pop up soon (hint)! Definitely dining again before I leave.
Healthy options Good customer service Nice atmosphere Pricey
Local fresh ingredients, lots of vegetarian options, very nice atmosphere
Amazing food, great service and decent pricing!! Would eat here again and again 😍
Pretty good food. A little overpriced for the drinks -- $3.50 for a cup of iced tea, but I will still go back again. I liked the spicy eggplant, and the chicken.
Healthy food. Comforting atmosphere
Super fresh food and organic wine on the menu. Highly recommend if in DC.
amazing place love it every time
(Translated by Google) It is a style that asks the vegetarian menu for topping yourself  (Original) ベジタリアンメニューに自分でトッピングを頼むスタイルです

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G! Me and my boyfriend came here for dinner tonight and it was perfect. Started with an amazing cashier who was super sweet. She answered all of our questions and was smiling and just so upbeat. Then the food... I got a chicken meal with Brussel Sprouts and Corn, while my boyfriend got the Glow dish. Both were INCREDIBLY delicious!!!! As someone who works in restaurant management,  I was blown out of the water. From start to finish was impeccable. I also want to call out the manager Danny (maybe Dan...). He stopped by on a table touch and we got into a full length conversation about the restaurant. He is incredibly knowledgeable and kind hearted. Such an asset to this restaurant! Very happy with my experience and I plan for us to come back as often as possible! 10/10!

I don't know why it took me so long to eat here but I finally made it over today. I took some friends who have different allergies bc I had a feeling this place would have good options for them. Well, we were all blown away! Mostly by the mac and cheese but also by the cauliflower, sweet potatoes, tofu, chicken, beef, and turkey salad. Everything was so flavorful and amazingly affordable!  The restaurant is pretty spacious with comfy seating and really cute flower arrangements.  I loved it! Can't wait to go back.

Place is clean and partially self serve. Cauliflower was good, quinoa had more lemon juice than we'd have liked. Salmon was pretty good. Spicy eggplant was our favorite. The tofu wasn't great. It was strange that the menu didn't say how the meats are cooked (e.g. what seasonings are used)

The lunch I got was fantastic - I got the Forbidden Rice bowl with tofu. There was enough for two meals, and the bowl was packed with all sorts of tasty veggies. I only held back a star because it took so long - I waited in line for twenty minutes and then waited for another ten minutes for my food (takeaway). It was well worth the wait, but hard to take that much time off of work for lunch.
Okay clean food

I spent 100 dollars with this company and I was going to use them for a small event. I was late picking up the order and they just threw my food away. I am utterly disgusted with this restaurant.  I had over 20 restaurants that I went to that day and this is the ONLY restaurant I had a problem with. Before they threw my food away they didnt call me or nothing. I spoke to Rudy and Daniel and I am just disgusted with their professionalism. Daniel did offer to make my food again but not after they suggested I pay another 100 for the order again. I will never come back here again. I am completely done. They did remake my food but I had to threaten a lawsuit.
The food is really good! I hope they could add calories count on the menu!

Loved the food, staff was friendly and the service was excellent. I chose an entree and there were many options to choose from to create your own combination. The sweet potatoes and brussel sprouts were some of the best I've had, along with nicely cooked and flavored steak.

Found this on G.Maps... we ate lunch here two days in a row. Both meals were really good! Love the fresh ingredients and unique blended dishes they serve. I actually suggested it for dinner on the previous day but the GF shot me down... The next day when we had our first lunch, she admitted that she should have listened to me 😁 and checked it out better because she would have had dinner here! (One point for me- lol)  Anyway, even if your a meat eater... You'll find steak here (in a salad or with veggies) I had chicken with my noodle bowl and the second day I had the Turkey Cobb- although the turkey was kinda like deli turkey... I expected bigger pieces like the chicken. But it was still a good salad.  My GF loved it here and would eat here everyday if she lived in DC. I loved it too-

The food here is so good, I do think it is alittle pricey especially since it is not certified organic or even organic. The salamon and the shrimp is amazing and the broccoli is amazing.  I love the rose petal lemonade and it is always a warm and friendly environment.
Fresh and delicious
I had Teriyaki shrimp and avocado($17), I thought it delicious, but I hope they can put more shrimp in it.
Food was alright! Could use some more flavor. The vibe was great and prices are very reasonable.
Kale salad was very delicious.

I am never a big fan of vegan food but I have to admit that food here tastes delicious! I tried their Grow Bowl and I really love it! Giving only 4/5 as food is pretty expensive here. $11 for a bowl of vegetables and I had to pay extra $7 for a tiny piece of salmon.
Really great food and ambience. Waitresses could be a bit more friendly and cheery.
Lovely folks and great food
Many vegetarian options. Good food.
Great food for people with food allergies and those looking to eat on the lighter side. Gluten free Mac and cheese was so good! The kitchen staff is friendly. We will be back!
Amazing vegetarian options at a reasonable price.
So good!

This place is amazing for a variety of healthy eats. I two plates; one with a protein and one with all veggies. The red chile glazed sweet potato was so flavorful and unlike any sweet potato I’ve ever had. I’d go here again just for that. The great food and the freshly made drinks make this a place you should stop at if you’re in DC.

Fast, fresh eats in a lively (and noisy) atmosphere. Went for lunch on a Friday and it was hard to find a seat.  Thankfully there's  communal space and people seemed willing to share.  Had the soup of the day, which was mushroom miso and tomato toast. It totaled out around $15.  Soup was good with lots of mushrooms and the toast was delicious but I feel like the portions were 80% what they should be for the price.  Guess I paid for the halo?  Service was friendly and quick. I was stoked to see that they use reusable plates and silver.

The only thing good on the menu is the breakfast burrito but at $10 for a meatless burrito it is a bit pricey, thankfully if you try to order it at 10:32 am they won't even try to sell it to you since breakfast is over at 10:30 am. So win-win. Yes, I work in the building above the restaurant, so when I am here 5 days a week I will plan on skipping in the future for the better options a few feet away.  Paul's is half a block away, SweetGreens has bigger, better salads and Beefsteak is actually vegan.

surprisingly huge eating space at this restaurant. Very fresh and delicious menu items along with original drinks and appetizers. Lots of space to sit and very well decorated. Outside space as well as inside seating spaces are available. I had the sweet potato and the roasted asparagus they were both delicious. I was here for a work meeting and happened to walk by this spot. I highly recommend it. I plan on bringing my whole family here.
Great food, but a little pricey for a lunch spot.
Delicious salad and kombucha
This place is good. Definitely a little overpriced though.
Pretty good but expensive
Great food Great Ambience

This place is really tasty and has fantastic vegetarian and vegan options! It’s super cute inside. They’re often crowded, but still get your food to you pretty quickly. The staff is really friendly, and all the food I’ve tried is delicious. The Mother Earth bowl is my favorite (they cook the mushrooms so well). It’s a tad bit expensive, but all the food is fresh and healthy, so I don’t mind. Portions are good— big enough that I’m really full when I leave, but I can still usually finish it at lunch time. I definitely recommend! They have beer and wine, too.
This place is incredible!!!! Amazing, healthy food prepared with precision and love.
Great choice. Interesting food. Fantastic beer.
Yummy and nourishing. What more can you ask for ?
- Tiny servings for price paid - Flavors were confused + Good Service
Awesome vegetarian and vegan. Definitely recommend a visit. Nice outdoor seating.
Many Vegan options... got the Thai Wrap!
Get the Mother Earth bowl!
Healthy vegan/veggie options, moderately priced, great taste.
Glad I found this place - I’m not always 100% vegan especially when traveling but the food is super fresh and delicious that I don’t want anything else.
Overpriced and small portions but at least it’s healthy.
Bad coffee and bad service
The food was absolutely delicious!
The food is very good and the concept is nice, but they seemed understaffed/underprepared for the lunch rush. Worth the wait if you have time but don't go here if you're in a rush.
(Translated by Google) Great  (Original) Ottimo
(Translated by Google) Good food ...  (Original) Gute Essen...
Amazing place to get some healthy and tasty food
Delicious food and quick service!

Nice addition to the DC downtown fast food scene. More vegan friendly than similar places, they have lots of vegetarian/vegan possibilities, as they have meat/fish/tofu add-on's to already substantial dishes. Menu: Food is generally healthy, and its possible to eating a filling meal with fewer carbs and more protein. Entrees are well thought out with a nice depth of flavor, and interesting  combinations of ingredients. Mother Earth and the Vegan Ramen bowl are good examples. Drink: On the expensive side, but not more so than other places. Prosecco is $8 for a small pour, this could be more competitively priced. Ambiance: Cute 60's like decor, with a fresh cafeteria feel. Cost: Average-high for a fast food place - we paid $50 for 3 people (including one drink each). Would recommend!
This was my 2nd time visiting Flower Child for lunch!! The food presentation matches the taste!! Everything taste fresh, even the drinks!! Your taste buds will thank you for it!
Amazing menu, something for everyone but especially good, hearty, hearty vegan and vegetarian cuisine. Will be going back soon!
Yummy, but toppings on tomato toast did not match generous serving in Boulder, CO.
Great Vegan choices...I will be back💚
great place for getting healthy food, we went for brunch and was good. vegan options are available but not many
Wouldn't recommend the vegan ramen. Flavors are ok but it seemed a bit heavy, sour, and spicy to me. The noodles themselves were stuck together and not that great.
My new favorite lunch place! Loved the cauliflower & quinoa...wanted to order 10 things. Great atmosphere
Tried the Thai Dye wrap for my first eating  experience at Flower Child and I left feeling unimpressed and not inspiring, which is a fitting description of the wrap itself.
Very nice presentation.  Food was very fresh.
Lots of healthy options to try. 😍
Lunch was amazing!  We all had great salads accompanied by amazing lemonade!
Nifty place, great variety of different health foods.salads wraps etc. Tea n lemonades are great.why does it smell funny inside is that just me? I'll be back
Cool!
Good food, many vegan, vegetarian and glutenfree options! Very good lemonade and tea options. But they don't recycle, so opt to use silverware if you are eating in.

Health-conscious menu offerings. I had the mother earth bowl with tofu and it was filling and delicious. Plenty of seating with a relaxed and open atmosphere, cute quirks here and there. Fast casual style. My body felt good here after eating such a nutritious and whole meal. Prices were a bit high, but didn't expect much from this part of town. I would come here again!
Great food. We arrived late and was treated to a real healthy feast. Thanks for the great service.
Awesome all the way around the board. They make u feel welcomed.
Pleasantly surprised very clean friendly staff and great food what's not to like?
The food made me HAPPY! Kenndra gave exceptional service and is very knowledgeable about the menu. The Strawberry Field Salad is a winner and fresh juices are amazingly fantastic!!!!

I have been to the Rockville location a few times and I am a fan. Zesty, tasty dishes that are apparently quite healthy - and judging by the other customers, the food here makes you young and beautiful (I am surprised they didn't make me sit in a back room reserved for those of us who didn't just come from a clothing catalog shoot). I got cauliflower and broccoli plates, with salmon. Fantastic! My only gripe: the salmon piece was pretty small. Even so, Flower Child is a Big Winner.

Everytime I go, I have a great experience. The young man at the register is always happy and helpful. Today I interacted with a lovely young lady who was filling the lemonade bins and she was a delight. On top of that, the food is fantastic!
Great selection and friendly staff.  Vegan and traditional menu choices.   Had the Vegan Ramen and it was delicious.
Got the Mother Earth bowl with salmon and it was amazing!

A great addition to the foggy bottom area. I had a great time here for a quick work time lunch. The vegan ramen was delicious. If you are looking for a sandwich, ramen, ice coffee or anything in between you can find it here. It’s a casual sit down - order at front and they bring you your food. Excellent place for a work lunch or a casual hang out with friends.
Food was ok, too expensive for what it is.

This is one of the best organic places in DC. My biggest challenge was choosing, because they have a menu full of great options, thoughtfully prepared and creatively flavored with dressings and light sauces. It gets very crowded at lunch, and I can see why.

Innovative healthy dishes bursting with flavor and charred to perfection. A vegan and gluten-free paradise with bountiful bowls/salad/wraps and good for meat-lovers with salmon, chicken, grass-fed steak - truly a crowd-pleaser.  Farm to table concept - everything is made from scratch with fresh ingredients, similar to True Foods Kitchen and notch above Urban Plates and Modern Market Eatery.  My hubby and I gleefully enjoyed watching our dishes get all fired up in the open oven! To my surprise, the round pizza style-oven isn't used to bake pizza, but rather to cook veggies and meats.  The Forbidden Rice (5/5) - Hits the spot! The veggie medley of broccoli, bok choy, snap peas, onions, purple and yellow carrots with fancy black pearl and red japonica rice coated in spicy hoisin sauce, topped with crunchy sesame seeds, and charred tofu was a home-run! All the ingredients blended well together with a nice smoky flavor from the fire roasted veggies. The seasoned tofu is worth paying the extra $4, great flavor! Generous portion size and satisfying - clean happy plate.  The Salmon with Broccoli and Mashed Potatoes plate (5/5) - My hubby relished the pan-seared juicy salmon, creamy potatoes, and tender broccoli. Clean plate - not a crumb was spared.  Avocado Toast (5/5) - The hearty multigrain bread with a touch of honey, avocado spread, soft egg, and topped with mild shredded cheddar cheese was a delight! It was an epic battle for the last piece.  Apple Spice Kombucha (5/5) - Sour apple, sweet and tangy with a tart finish. If you love sourpatch or Granny Smith apple, go for it!  Chocolate Chip Cookie (2/5) - I wasn't a fan of the oily brittle cookie. While I love moist cookies with a crispy outer layer, the gluten-free cookie missed the mark. The coconut shavings didn't quite work well.  Service was the best part! (5/5) - Our meal took about 15 - 20 min to make, not a long wait time at all. The server, David, profusely apologized with a warm smile and treated us with an extra round of the Apple Spice Kombucha. Perfect ending to a delicious meal!  Looking forward to another culinary adventure and making our way through the menu!
Great food, great Vibes, great Lemonades
Very good service, clean friendly environment, with very good food I had Bird's the word and sweet potato bok choy and sesame.
The only good thing about my meal was the water. It tasted really weird and didn't fulfill my hunger. Overpriced and overrated. Loved the wallpaper though
This is what food should be-- tasty, healthy, beautiful, unpretentious and served with warmth and love.

Fantastic quick service restaurant! Top quality food ingredients, ability to customize order, vast options for gluten-free, vegan, or vegetarian options. Although this restaurant is relatively new, it is exceptionall well run and managed!! Had a delicious dinner here and will definitely be back to try other menus items.

Flower Child is like the new cool kid that joins your high school. It's from the West Coast, looks beautiful, and every millennial wants to get selfies with its catchy phrases brightly painted on its walls. Despite it making me feel like I am not cool enough, I left a big fan. Here's why:  1) Food: It's excellent. They source local ingredients (at least they make you feel like they do) and cook healthier food in an open kitchen. They sell salads, wraps, and plates (where you can pick two sides with sliced chicken or beef). I ordered a plate of gluten-free mac and cheese and brussel sprouts. Both were among the best I've had in the city. The chicken breast I got with it was perfectly, lightly seasoned. I also got a gluten-free soft chocolate chip cookie and a freshly made pomegranate ginger lemonade (they give you a cup so it's free refills). My bill came to just under $23 (yep, expensive).  2) Vibes: The staff definitely came across friendly, but with a little "I am cooler than you" vibes. Despite that, they were nice, efficient, and seemed proud to work there.  3) Space: It's simple yet colorful. There's a large open space with tables in the middle and tables off to the side as well. The light comes in easily making it simple to snap a photo, post it to Snapchat/Instagram, and tag Flower Child.  I am impressed. Flower Child has somehow made eating healthier cool again. Welcome to Washington, D.C., Flower Child!

Very disappointed.  I ordered a take out Vietnamese  crunch salad for lunch.  For $10, I got a pile of coarsely cut greens (part of the core of the savoy cabbage included), with a few slices of tomatoes, a slice of mandarin and avocado.  Nothing else.  The portion came out considerable smaller than salads served for dine-in guests.  For any added protein is an additional charge of $5(!), no bread available at all.  What's the hype about!   only the fact they serve wine and beer! Sweetgreen is so much better in all respects.!
Plenty of delicious gluten and dairy free or vegan options.

As an Arizona native, I have been very excited for this to open since I saw the sign go up ..... one of my favorites from home, and right in my neighborhood! For my opening day visit, I had the Glow Bowl, with the shredded chicken mixed in. Highly recommended! It is served hot, and the veggies all have a nice crunch. There’s a little bit of a kick as well. The staff are all very friendly and the service is quick. Can’t wait for my next meal!

Finally open!  Very promising little spot that’s good for the soul and the belly!  Had the organic kale salad which proved to be a masterful combination of taste (smoky almonds, grape fruit, currants and cheddar cheese) with a nice crunch.  Not too sweet, not to salty, but just right.  Will definitely come back and order it again!
Thai dye and flat white were excellent. Fast, efficient and friendly service. Tons of great vegan and vegetarian options.
